pr_title: Fix range query on date fields for number inputs

timeline.message:
Fix range quers on date fields for number inputs

Currently, if you write a date range query with numeric 'to' or 'from' bounds,
they can be interpreted as years if no format is provided. We use
"strict_date_optional_time||epoch_millis" in this case that can interpret inputs
like 1000 as the year 1000 for example. We should change this to always
interpret and parse numbers in this case with the second option "epoch_millis"
if no other formatter was provided.

Closes #63680

timeline.bodyText: I think Number is better here. That, or Long and Integer. Its kind of plain luck that the range of numbers that cause the bug are small and so parsed as an Integer instead of a Long or whatever. But tests and stuff could still end up with a Long.
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: Should we just cast them to a number and call longValue on them? It feels like a shame to toString them and then parse them if we know they are numbers.
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: I explored that option but it's not as nice as thought at first. Needed to move code elsewhere to leverage the whole null-handling and also think we need to consider the millis/nanos resolution, but take a look at the latest commit and let me know what you think
replies.author: cbuescher

timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: I think we need "resolution.convert" here to this gets kind of ugly. I personally prefer the earlier variant where we just have a "toString" detour but keep the rest of the code as-is.
timeline.author: cbuescher

replies.bodyText: Yeah. I think you are right. If this were super performance sensitive code I'd argue more, but building queries typically isn't. I think going back is probably the right thing.
replies.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: Interestingly we weren't very precise about this in our own tests.
timeline.author: cbuescher
